Comparison of prison populations: The expert analyzed the prison populations of Minnesota and Wisconsin, noting that Minnesota has half as many people imprisoned as Wisconsin.
Comparison of crime rates: The expert compared the crime rates of the two states, using FBI statistics from 2016. They found that Minnesota had a slightly higher crime rate than Wisconsin.
Use of credible sources: The expert referenced data from the U.S. Department of Justice and The Sentencing Project, both reputable sources, to support their claim.
Expert opinion: The expert cited the opinion of Michael Tonry, director of the Institute on Crime and Public Policy at the University of Minnesota, who stated that prison rate comparisons are more reliable than crime rate comparisons.
